title: Access Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Collin College (Plano, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted via email to set up an in-person interview. Overall good experience, about 10-15 questions were asked and they mostly pertained to the job duties of this position. Nice supervisor.
Interview Questions: Mostly scenario and behavioral questions.

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Collin College (Plano, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I first applied online, then I responded via emails. After this, I sent a portfolio of work, they also asked that a sample be created according to their specifications. There were two rounds of online video interviews and an HR appointment as the final step.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with faculty that have low technological expertise?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very laid back and  outgoing. It was more like a conversation than an interview. More like experience sharing than one by one question. I enjoyed it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself type.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: Despite the fact that I was nervous, the interviewers were easygoing and kind. I enjoyed talking to them and responding with short stories for my answers. This was my first in-person interview after the pandemic.
Interview Questions: Give an example of excellent customer service.

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to display my tutoring style and tested on my knowledge of several mathematical principles. I was also asked to explain why I would be a good fit for the job and what my strengths and weaknesses are.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this job?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of interviews focused on professional background and skills, including a work sample requested to show demonstration of skills. This work sample required demonstration of using an LMS and creating a multimedia presentation.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to faculty members who are not tech savvy?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Collin College (Plano, TX) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very long. It' s a great place to work but you have to be very patient with HR. They are very slow. The process can be discouraging but if you hang in there it will be worth it.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an irate student or parent?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a colleague who could no longer teach due to scheduling issues. I was asked to come in by the department chair for an informal interview. Sat down with department chair and discussed my experience and what I would bring to the classes on the schedule. They called afterward to confirm that I was hired.
Interview Questions:
What courses have you taught before? 
What books would you use for X course?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by three people. This was my first ever job and they were all very nice and made it less stressful. They had my resume and asked me to go over my resume with them.
Interview Questions: what relevant experiences do you have?

title: Professor of Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Collin College (McKinney, TX) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: And I’m used to interviewing with the search committee, but the dean of nursing and leadership team I met with did not seem to be supportive of the nursing program. I interviewed because the nursing program was a nationally recognized program, but NCLEX scores have dropped and the other nursing professors complain about everything. It was an easy interview I chose not to take the job because of the above stated reasons.
Interview Questions: Provide a 15 minute lecture that you would give to nursing students on an assigned topic.

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was frustrating at best. It took months and several rounds of virtual interviews. After interviews lots of waiting time to hear any status updates.  Big lack of communication.
Interview Questions: Mostly hypothetical behavioral questions. If ___ occurred how would you respond.

title: Testing Center Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: Relevant questions; quick follow up and standards questions asked. Questions related to the testing position were asked. The interview questions were relevant to the position and lasted about 30 minutes
Interview Questions: How would you work in a conflict setting?

title: Accounts Payable Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Collin College (McKinney, TX) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: In person interview which consist two level interview and screening and quiz. There were two interviewer who asked multiple job related and senario based questions. The interview was last for 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: It was thorough. I applied online, and they reached out to set an interview. The interview was in person and mostly behavioral questions were asked. Two people conducted the interview, and then they contacted me regarding the offer.
Interview Questions: How would you handle stress situations?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: It was thorough but quick. They were mostly behavioral questions and related to situations you would do in certain situations, which tested how you would handle situations in the position.
Interview Questions: How would you handle stress situations?

title: UX/UI Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Collin College in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: They called me up to schedule an interview time, gave me a design project to do to prep then a two hour long interview. They were all friendly and great about getting back to me which was a surprise. Didn't get to complete the presentation on the project we had to complete for the interview though because of some communication issue HR had.
Interview Questions: There were four different people who took turns asking me questions.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Collin College (McKinney, TX) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Non subjective questions. Questions that truly related to how my experience would work in the position.  Questions that allowed honesty and information gained that was realistic about working at this organization
Interview Questions: Describe your past experience as an Adjunct Professor

title: Information Technology Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Collin College (Dallas, TX) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions nothing crazy.  Very laid back, but don't get too comfortable.  Maintain professionalism and let them know you really want it. Just be yourself and you should be fine.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with an angry end user?

title: Testing Center Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Collin College (McKinney, TX) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great. Asked questions related to the job. Asked typical interview questions such as what's my greatest strength and weakness. Asked what integrity means to me and other similar questions.
Interview Questions: What's one of my strengths?

title: Reference Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Collin College (McKinney, TX) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Part time position, interviewed by one person who talked about herself for 45 minutes before asking a single question.  At that point she asked why I didn't interview for ANOTHER job they were hiring for.  I explained that work was with serials, not students, and I spent 20+ years working with students. She was not happy with that and the interview did not proceed well. She did not seem to understand that I am well paid and highly valued in a current full-time job.  Also, felt she was trying to be coercive to help herself, instead of assessing my as a prospective candidate.
Interview Questions: How would I help a patron with a reference question when I really did not know the answer.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Collin College (Plano, TX) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: application online, then a face to face interview. Mine was with 3 different people. behavioral and background questions. it was a great experience they were cool and understanding. i was chosen by one of the interviewers to work directly in her department
Interview Questions: can you tell us about a time you had a problem with a coworker

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Collin College (Richardson, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process went smoothly. First had a panel interview and then 2 other executives. 
The interviews lasted about an hour and a half.
The only drawback was I waited almost three weeks for the decision.
Interview Questions: What’re your strengths? What are your weaknesses?

title: Technology Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Collin College (Dallas, TX) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was stale to say the least. It consisted of two people sitting across from me taking turns asking questions off a sheet of paper. They were your typical interview questions (name your strengths/weaknesses) with no sense of conversation whatsoever. The two even got their questions mixed up and couldn't decide who was supposed to ask the next question.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an situation which required you to be in two places at one time.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Collin College (Frisco, TX) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Quick one in person interview. Was hired that week. Only interviewed with one person. Asked a few questions about myself and why I wanted to work there. Job was offered based on my qualifications.
Interview Questions: Tell me a bit about yourself. Where do you see yourself in 10 years. What makes you want to work here. Why is this job appealing.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick but the hiring process took over a month. The interview itself was pretty standard. I met with the director over the department that I applied for. I was then told that I'd hear back from them or HR if I was offered the position. I figured I didn't get it since it took over a month for HR To call me.
Interview Questions: What sets you apart from the other candidates?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Collin College (Plano, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was with more than one employer, I had five people interviewing me but it wasn't scary or intimidating. Basically, they go over your resume and make sure you're a good fit for the position, no complicated questions. mainly behavioral ones.
Interview Questions: Do you have Microsoft skills?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with a committee of 2-3 advisors, including the director of advising. Interview is relatively brief. Questions were relevant to the job. HR takes some time so hiring process can seem a little daunting but it is definitely worth it.
Interview Questions: "How do you deal with stress?", and student situation-based questions

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Collin College (McKinney, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job online, through the HR website. Received a call some time later to have an interview set up. When I showed up on the day of the interview, I was seen quickly. The interviewer was not especially warm or inviting, although they did make a point of letting me read over the  job description (the same one that had been posted online, to which I applied). The interview lasted about 20-30 minutes and was very much interview-style rather than conversational. As a professional who has interviewed candidates in the past, I feel strongly that an interviewer should try to put the candidate at ease in order to gain a better insight into who that person is. Regardless, I was told that a decision would be made within a week, but I never heard from them again. No call, no email, no nothing. Extremely unprofessional.
Interview Questions: To describe how I would handle a workload while constantly being interrupted (part of the job).

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Collin College (Frisco, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and had two in persons interview. The director of advising and other advisors enjoyed my answers and both interviews went very well. HR sent me consent to do a background check. I knew I had the job. Then the director of advising called me and stated HR said I need a year of academic affairs experience. Why even have me come in for interviews just to not hire me. I have two degrees and great experience. I was qualified.
Interview Questions: What three skills do you think a advisor should have?

title: Part Timer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Collin College (Plano, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Average interview with who was going to be my boss. A lot of situational scenario questions. I was given a review of the job and its description, a list of daily tasks, and given the hourly pay information. Was told I would hear back within the week, a week later they called, very prompt.
Interview Questions: Cliche questions: What would you do if....

title: Curator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Collin College (Dallas, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Online job application, in-person committee interview for the position. The committee members met ahead of time for the interview and had prepared extensive questions. I was given the questions to briefly look over while being interviewed which help with the more in-depth questions. The faculty and members of the committee were very professional and the questions were overall on point to the position of hire.
Interview Questions: What are your two favorite artists and why? What trend do you see happening in art?

title: Professor, Humanities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Collin College (McKinney, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submit a lengthy online application to HR; participate in an over the phone interview with the hiring committee; interview in person with the entire hiring committee of full-time faculty members, meet with and interview with the Dean. The follow-up and job offer were conducted via telephone.  Oddly, the Dean sounded surprised when I accepted the offer tendered.
Interview Questions:
What is your greatest strength in the classroom?
Would you please elaborate on your credentials?
Why should we hire you?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Collin College (McKibben, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: 30 minutes job fit and behavioral interview. Straight forward and not too complicated if you know what you're talking about. The hiring manager and a few others were there. Very friendly and straight forward folks. Was happy to be part of the team
Interview Questions: Give as an example of a time that you had to find an out-of-the box solution

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Collin College (Plano, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with employer in the office in a calm environment. Asked questions pertaining to job, such as ability with Microsoft Office and how I react in certain situations. Overall your basic interview questions, but expect demonstrating your skills as well (such as formatting a document or displaying CPR certification)
Interview Questions: Do you know how to adjust the printing of a powerpoint to where you can print out multiple slides on one page?

title: Math Lab Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Collin College (Frisco, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: They called me and scheduled a day for an interview before the semester started. we sat down we two of the employees. they asked me some question of why I wanted to work there and I also took an easy exam
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna work here?

title: Associate Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Collin College
Interview Descriptions: Met with department chair, went over applicable experience, talked about class opportunities and schedule. Toured the building and showed me how to access everything I would need. Worked with me on what classes I could teach with my schedule.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Contract Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Collin College (Plano, TX) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with community sales reps and department heads. I was asked to deliver a training of my choice and asked my training/educational philosophy. Pretty standard. Not intimidating. Very nice and professional group of panelists who are looking to employ your services to the community so they were looking to where they could use your style.
Interview Questions: Various training styles used in training setting to reach objective of course/presentation to group.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Collin College (Plano, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I had applied online, so I was contacted by phone by the department chair of Communication to submit all of the necessary paperwork and then a meeting date was set for an on-campus interview right before the start of the spring semester. I was informed that I would be joining three other people in a group interview in a conference room at the Spring Creek Campus in Plano. The department chair provided sample syllabi and an employee packet that provided necessary instructions on adjunct office locations, email account creation, phone numbers and contacts.

The interview itself lasted about an hour. Each person was asked about their background and what they would prefer to teach: speech communication or public speaking. The time of day was also determined according to individual schedules.

We were then offered the chance to ask questions about the campus, class size and format and what kind of expectations and requirements did the college expect of its part-time faculty.
Interview Questions: Are you available to teach a morning block of classes?
